participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

subjectkey.Description: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject

src_subject_id.Description: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project

interview_date.Description: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

interview_age.Description: Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging. | Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

sex.Description: Sex of subject at birth | M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

eventname.Description: The event name for which the data was collected

sleepdisturb1_p.Description: How many hours of sleep does your child get on most nights? ¿Cuántas horas duerme su niño(a) la mayoría de las noches? | 1 = 9-11 hours/ 9 a 11 horas; 2 = 8-9 hours /8 a 9 horas; 3 = 7-8 hours /7 a 8 horas; 4 = 5-7 hours /5 a 7 horas; 5 = Less than 5 hours/ Menos de 5 horas// Consider each question pertaining to the PAST 6 MONTHS of the child's life

Levels.2: 8-9 hours /8 a 9 horas
Levels.3: 7-8 hours /7 a 8 horas
Levels.4: 5-7 hours /5 a 7 horas
Levels.5: Less than 5 hours/ Menos de 5 horas// Consider each question pertaining to the PAST 6 MONTHS of the child's life

sleepdisturb2_p.Description: How long after going to bed does your child usually fall asleep? Después de acostarse ¿generalmente cuánto tiempo tarda su niño(a) en quedarse dormido(a)? | 1 = Less than 15 minutes /Menos de 15 minutos; 2 = 15-30 minutes 15 a 30 minutos; 3 = 30-45 minutes /30 a 45 minutos; 4 = 45-60 minutes /45 a 60 minutos; 5 = More than 60 minutes /Más de 60 minutos//Consider each question pertaining to the PAST 6 MONTHS of the child's life

Levels.2: 15-30 minutes 15 a 30 minutos
Levels.3: 30-45 minutes /30 a 45 minutos
Levels.4: 45-60 minutes /45 a 60 minutos
Levels.5: More than 60 minutes /Más de 60 minutos//Consider each question pertaining to the PAST 6 MONTHS of the child's life

sleepdisturb3_p.Description: The child goes to bed reluctantly. El niño/ la niña se va a la cama de mala gana. | 1 = Never /Nunca; 2 = Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) /Ocasionalmente (1 o 2 veces al mes o menos); 3 = Sometimes (once or twice per week) /A veces (1 o 2 veces a la semana); 4 = Often (3 or 5 times per week)/ A menudo (de 3 a 5 veces a la semana); 5 = Always (daily) /Siempre (diariamente)// Consider each question pertaining to the PAST 6 MONTHS of the child's life

Levels.2: Occasionally (once or twice per month or less) /Ocasionalmente (1 o 2 veces al mes o menos)
Levels.3: Sometimes (once or twice per week) /A veces (1 o 2 veces a la semana)
Levels.4: Often (3 or 5 times per week)/ A menudo (de 3 a 5 veces a la semana)
Levels.5: Always (daily) /Siempre (diariamente)// Consider each question pertaining to the PAST 6 MONTHS of the child's life
